item.title: Using Raspbian on 2GB Micro SD Card
item.description: Raspberry Pi 2 with Raspbian on a 2GB micro SD card? Feasible. If you need additional space for storing data, you can always attach thumb drives.

item.title: Setup NodeJS with Apache ProxyPass on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Setup NodeJS with Apache ProxyPass on Raspberry Pi 2 and 3. This allows multiple NodeJS apps to run in the backend but under a single hostname/domain with different virtual subfolder path for each of them.

item.title: BYOD CI/CD build machine to run pipelines using Docker
item.description: Skip the build queue and save money by reducing (if not eliminating) dedicated build machines by Bringing Your Own Device (BYOD) as CI/CD build machine to run pipelines using Docker.

item.title: GitLab CI remove priority zero from Hugo sitemap
item.description: Hugo static site generator generates sitemap.xml that include priority zero URLs. These are the taxanomies, tags and categories. To prevent these from appearing in Google Search results, GitLab CI can be configured to remove unwanted XML nodes (priority 0) from sitemap.xml.

item.title: Running .NET Core on Raspberry Pi Raspbian
item.description: Easy guide to running .NET Core 2.0 applications on Raspberry Pi 2 and 3 with Raspbian Stretch.

item.title: Build online radio player using Raspberry Pi
item.description: Simple guide to building an online radio player using Raspberry Pi with Android/iOS device as remote control.

item.title: Setup HAProxy with CloudFlare SSL termination on OpenWRT
item.description: Setup instructions for HAProxy with HTTP SSL termination on OpenWRT with CloudFlare Origin CA and Authenticated Origin Pulls.

item.title: CloudFlare Origin CA on Raspberry Pi Apache
item.description: Immediately after reading CloudFlare’s blog post on the introduction of Origin CA, I tried it on my Raspberry Pi Apache. Read on for the details.

item.title: Automate Raspberry Pi UFW to allow CloudFlare inbound
item.description: As IPv6 restores the ability to have end-to-end connectivity unlike IPv4 shielded by NAT, I needed to configure my Raspberry Pi firewall to allow only CloudFlare traffic inbound on port 443. Read on for the solution.

item.title: Apache 2 Event MPM and PHP 5 FastCGI on Raspberry Pi
item.description: I have been running my blog on Apache 2 with Event MPM for a while and thought I should share my setup on Raspberry Pi 2 Model B with Raspbian for the benefit of others.

item.title: How to disable IPv6 on Raspberry Raspbian
item.description: An easy guide on how to disable IPv6 on Raspbian that anyone can accomplish in just a few minutes. Tested on Raspbian Jessie.

item.title: LAMP stack on Raspberry Pi with Kodi running at startup
item.description: For most people, if they wanted to run LAMP stack on Raspberry Pi, they would probably install Raspbian via NOOBS. However, if they wanted a HTPC with Kodi, they would likely opt for OSMC or OpenELEC. I needed Kodi to run at startup with LAMP stack running behind and chose the NOOBS Raspbian route.

item.title: OpenSSL benchmark - RPi2B vs NAS vs Archer C7
item.description:
I am not short of options when it comes to spreading tasks over several System-on-Chip (SoC) based low-powered micro computers. 4 devices were tested; OpenWRT running on TP-Link Archer C7 v2, QNAP TS-220 and Asustor AS-304T and Raspberry Pi 2 Model B.

In deciding which to be used for hosting a HTTPS-only web server, I was interested in the cryptography (namely RSA and AES) performance thus the motivation for running benchmarks.
